data.event: Georgetown was established in 1826 and was platted by James Haworth, although the first home was established in 1820 by Henry Johnson.
Georgetown was established in 1826 and was platted by James Haworth, although the first home was established in 1820 by Henry Johnson.
The first post office was established in 1828.
The Paris and Danville Railroad was built in 1871, and the "Interurban" started carrying passengers between Georgetown and Danville sometime after 1900.
